original_title: Singapore’s defense against rising seas? Its very own ‘Long Island’ | CNN
article_summary: Singapore plans to build an 8-mile-long string of artificial islands, dubbed "Long Island," to protect its southeastern coast from rising sea levels and serve as a new reservoir to address water shortage issues. The project, which could take decades and billions of dollars, aims to create over 12 miles of new waterfront parks, residential, recreational, and commercial spaces, and potentially house 30,000 to 60,000 homes.</s>
